title: How to Use Miso

steps.headline: Use in place of or in addition to stock.
steps.description: Miso can be used where you might use a stock, either in place of that stock or to boost the flavour of a less strong-tasting stock.

steps.headline: Use in place of soy sauce, salt or anchovy paste.
steps.description: These salty additions to food can be easily substituted by miso without losing the salty spark.

steps.headline: Make soup.
steps.description:
This is the most common usage of miso. A very simple version is:
Mix miso with water, add cut spring onions (scallions), mushrooms and tiny chunks of tofu. Sprinkle a little pepper. Drink as is or add udon noodles for a substantial soup.

steps.headline: Create a marinade.
steps.description: Add to marinade sauces or even use just on its own.

steps.headline: Flavour gravy.
steps.description: Add a couple of spoonfuls to make gravy taste really good.

steps.headline: Make a dressing.
steps.description:
A very simple and tasty dressing can be made as follows:
Mix miso with preferred oil, grated fresh ginger, and finely chopped fresh garlic. Pour over salad.

steps.headline: Add to mashed potato.
steps.description: Add miso instead of milk; simply dissolve in a little hot water and mash through. Use the light miso for this purpose; it will taste delicious!

steps.headline: Try a wikiHow miso recipe.
steps.description: wikiHow has some miso recipes. See "Relateds" for some recipes to sample. Feel free to add more miso recipes to wikiHow.

text:
Use in place of or in addition to stock. Miso can be used where you might use a stock, either in place of that stock or to boost the flavour of a less strong-tasting stock. Use in place of soy sauce, salt or anchovy paste. These salty additions to food can be easily substituted by miso without losing the salty spark. Make soup. This is the most common usage of miso. A very simple version is:
Mix miso with water, add cut spring onions (scallions), mushrooms and tiny chunks of tofu. Sprinkle a little pepper. Drink as is or add udon noodles for a substantial soup. Create a marinade. Add to marinade sauces or even use just on its own. Flavour gravy. Add a couple of spoonfuls to make gravy taste really good. Make a dressing. A very simple and tasty dressing can be made as follows:
Mix miso with preferred oil, grated fresh ginger, and finely chopped fresh garlic. Pour over salad. Add to mashed potato. Add miso instead of milk; simply dissolve in a little hot water and mash through. Use the light miso for this purpose; it will taste delicious! Try a wikiHow miso recipe. wikiHow has some miso recipes. See "Relateds" for some recipes to sample. Feel free to add more miso recipes to wikiHow.
